messages: 1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:00): jmoncayo: NO! I told you already that apache can't simply 'drop' a connection if it doesn't like the Host: header.
3f66260edae469f8cefa4afb512f11be (02:01): noodl: so what should i add now
3f66260edae469f8cefa4afb512f11be (02:01): noodl: where will all the asdfasdf.jmoncayo.ath.cx go now?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:02): To the default vhost, which is the first one listed.
3f66260edae469f8cefa4afb512f11be (02:03): if i add something like *.jmoncayo.ath.cx /var/www/error/error.html will do it for me?
3f66260edae469f8cefa4afb512f11be (02:13): noodl: what about this ServerAlias jmoncayo.ath.cx for ServerName www.jmoncayo.ath.cx ?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:15): jmoncayo: I tend to do it differently though. http://apache.pastebin.ca/190269
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:15): usually, ServerName will have the domain and ServerAlias will have the www.domain.com
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:15): but either way will work...
3f66260edae469f8cefa4afb512f11be (02:18): are those spaces http://www. jmoncayo.ath.cx or typo??
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:18): can't have spaces in urls
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:19): well, can't have spaces in domain names...

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:23): apachelounge is www.apachelounge.com and has Windows binaries of a number of modules or http://www.apachelounge.com/download/ to get directly to the download page.

853e2b23c6b731cd4ece34703a023c26 (03:05): Any of you folks know how to retain %1 backreference from RewriteCond to Rewriterule if there is more than one rule
853e2b23c6b731cd4ece34703a023c26 (03:05): it seems the first RewriteRule following a RewriteCond has no issues retaining %1, but any rule after that does not
853e2b23c6b731cd4ece34703a023c26 (03:05): I'm probably missing a flag somewhere
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (03:07): zuez: Conditions only ever apply to a single rule.
853e2b23c6b731cd4ece34703a023c26 (03:10): noodl; ah dang, so there's no way to pass that %1 to more than one rule
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (03:10): zuez: Sure there is, you could use an environment variable.. What is it you're trying to achive?
